instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?[/PLAIN]

Not switching on, owner says it was on until battery went flat, but now does not switch on or charge. I have a schematic for it, but no board view. Is there a board view anywhere for it? The schematic says it needs 20v, but I only have a normal 85w charger for MacBook Pro which is a lower voltage, so is there another type of MacBook Pro charger which is a higher voltage? When connecting what I have the light on it goes green then red as though it is charging so what gives?
Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
It should be an original 85W charger MagSafe 2....
voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>??
resistance between pins 17-18 and 27-28 from <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>???......

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: How do I find the components on the board with no board view. There isn't a board view in the schematic either.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: You can find the IC because it have a number over it and the distribution of the components around it is almost the same on every board... To find <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, it is on pin 23 from <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> or y any component attached to teh same line.....

threads.message:
No Title

OK I will look for it. I have found the components on the board, the black beeps the green does not. Are they types of fuse?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: First off get an ORIGINAL REAL 85W magsafe 2 charger. This thing will not power on from anything else.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
Damn, just realised the psu U was using was 65W,
Using 85W:
Light on connector goes green then red.
Voltage at the green component on each side goes between 16.1v and 16.85v.
On the assumption have got the correct pin 23 on the isl 6259 as high lighted in the attached picture the voltage goes between 1.65v and 1.66v

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
You didn't post resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 yet.
If OK, post voltages for <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, like 2, 3, 19, 20, 1, 26, 9, 15.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: Will get resistances and voltages. Am I to assume I am correct from the picture about where pin 23 is?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
Pin 17-18 resistance 4.4 200 ohm setting

Pin 27-28 resistance .909 on 2k setting

Pin:

2 16.6v

3 3.9v

19 5.5v

20 5.51v

1 0v

26 0v

9 4.33v

15 0.5v

All voltages little bit up and down apart from pin 19 and 15

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: I am thinking I need to look at <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>, where abouts is it on the board?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: OK probably not gonna be able to as I have just found it after finding in on a 2013 MacBook Air board then found the same component on the MacBook Pro board

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
Look at schematic and tell me why there should be 20 Ohm between pins 27/28. You measured 4.4 between 17/18 which is probably OK, but should really be 2.2.
Also make sure your 85W charger is REAL! No China knock offs for testing!

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: What an Engels idiot I am. I just answered the question and never thought about the answer. Ok so <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> and 10 Ohm each and looking at the schematic they are in series so adding them together, between pin 27 and 28 should give 20 Ohms. 0.909 is pretty much open circuit so something has burnt out. I say this as I am guessing <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> has something to do with the circuit and probably burnt out unless a track is burnt out. I have guessed the location of <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> and am hopefully correct due to the readings I got. Where is <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> though?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> could be in the other side of the board; did you check?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: I have looked for the same component on a MacBook Air board 820 3437 and found it, looking for the same type of thing and not found it yet so still looking.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
Isn't your board similar to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?
That one has boardview file...
I saw refferences on Internet as <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fro same Venus X245G logic board.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
Hi,
I got the board view file and they are different boards, but it did lead me to the faulty component. <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> was burnt out. I replaced it from a MacBook Air board. With the board in the computer, and power connected, it gives a green then red light, logic board gets warm as though it is charging from a genuine Apple charger. It switches on and gives fan spin then the happy tone, fans keep spinning, but nothing appears on screen. So now I am working back from the screen connector to find out what is going on there.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
Put same 20miliohms at <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>; to avoid any future problems.
10miliohms will work too, but current sense reported to SMC will not be correct...
Hope you solve the backlight issue fast now.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: If I find the very same component I will use it. I don't know if it is backlight or graphics issue, but I an looking for voltages at the moment.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: Put flashlight through the back of the screen to see. Also realize this won't show you anything with 2012-2014 model LCD.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: Tried that a few hours ago with my iPhone flash. Didn't show a single ray of light through the apple symbol so I'm guessing it is the later version. It is a retina, I'm on another steep learning curve.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message:
Update on the no graphics issue, looking at the schematic pin 28 29 and 30 end up at <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>. Cannot find <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> yet, but may have found <CHIP>U8330</CHIP>. Putting <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> aside, pin 28 39 and 30 are shorted to ground, so is  L8300 and, I am guessing everything that goes back to at least <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>. Looking for other voltages going to the lcd connector, there should be 3.3v going to pin 5. There is nothing there and it is not shorting to ground, any voltages tested up to now have been tested with lcd connected nd disconnected.
Still looking

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: Find the short on <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, there are only like 5 components on that line.

threads.message: Didn't  notice there were so few, still looking for the component, but will do that tomorrow. Been at work for the last 14 hours, I have a cold and my head hurts so am going home.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: Oh goody, found the short only appeared when the screen was connected, looking at the connector the last pin is damaged so is that just a new cable? Does the cable go into the screen therefore the screen needs taking to pieces if that is possible?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not switch on after short from charger, what charger does it need?
threads.message: With careful placement I have managed to get the cable in despite the bent pin and now all is well. Switching on again and all fine. Movie uploading to YouTube as I type.
